question.text: Which of the following is correct about hybridization?

options.label: A.
options.text: Hybridization is a permanent characteristic of an element

options.label: B.
options.text: sp , sp 2 , and sp 3 orbitals have the same shape

options.label: C.
options.text: All hybridized orbitals of sp 3 have the same energy

options.label: D.
options.text: There are only three types of hybridized orbitals: sp , sp 2 , and sp 3

options.label: E.
options.text: All atoms in a molecule must undergo hybridization

correct_answer_text: All hybridized orbitals of sp 3 have the same energy

explanation.concept_text: Option A. Hybridization is a permanent characteristic of an element Incorrect. Hybridization of an element's orbitals can change when it forms different compounds or participates in various chemical reactions. Therefore, it is not a permanent characteristic of an element. Hybridization of an element can change when an atom forms. Option B. sp, sp 2 , and sp 3 orbitals have the same shape Incorrect. sp , sp 2 , and sp 3 orbitals do not have the same shape. In sp hybridization, one s orbital and one p orbital combine to form two sp hybrid orbitals. In sp 2 hybridization, one s orbital and two p orbitals combine to form three sp 2 hybrid orbitals. In sp 3 hybridization, one s orbital and three p orbitals combine to form four sp 3 hybrid orbitals. So, these three types of hybridization result in orbitals with distinctly different shapes. (The exact shape of these orbitals are not important for the exam.) Option C. All hybridized orbitals of sp 3 have the same energy Correct. In sp 3 hybridization, where one s -orbital and three p -orbitals combine to form four sp 3 hybrid orbitals, all the resulting hybrid orbitals have the same energy. Option D. There are only three types of hybridized orbitals: sp, sp 2 , and sp 3 Incorrect. There can be additional hybridization types beyond sp , sp 2 , and sp 3 in more complex molecules, especially those involving d -orbitals. Some examples of additional hybridization types include sp 3 d and sp 3 d 2 . Option E. All atoms in a molecule must undergo hybridization Incorrect. In a molecule, some atoms may undergo hybridization while others may not. It depends on the structure of the molecule. For example, CH 4 has a central carbon atom that undergoes sp 3 hybridization to form four equivalent sp 3 hybrid orbitals, which then form sigma bonds with s orbitals of 4 hydrogen atoms. Although the carbon’s orbital is hybridized, the hydrogen’s orbitals are not. Therefore, the answer is C .

options.label: C.
options.text: a change in the mass of an atom.

options.label: E.
options.text: no change in geometry of orbitals.

explanation.concept_text: Option A. the formation of new elements. Incorrect. Hybridization does not involve the creation of new elements. Hybridization involves the atomic orbitals of existing elements combining to form new molecular orbitals within molecules. Option B. a physical change in matter. Incorrect. Hybridization is not a physical change in matter. Hybridization describes the rearrangement of electron orbitals within atoms to form hybrid orbitals. Physical change involves a change in the physical properties of a substance (such as state) without changing its chemical composition. Option C. a change in the mass of an atom. Incorrect. Hybridization does not bring about a significant change in the mass of an atom. An atom's mass is predominantly dictated by the total number of protons and neutrons in its nucleus, with electrons contributing negligibly to its overall weight. Option D. the mixing of atomic orbitals. Correct. Hybridization combines the atomic orbitals of an atom to create new hybrid orbitals. These hybrid orbitals have different shapes and energies than the original atomic orbitals. Option E. no change in geometry of orbitals. Incorrect. Hybridization is closely related to changes in the geometry of atomic orbitals. By mixing atomic orbitals, hybridization can lead to the formation of new hybrid orbitals with specific geometries. Therefore, the answer is D .

question.text: Which of the following molecules has a central atom with sp 2 hybridization?

explanation.concept_text: To solve this problem involving hybridization , we need to know that how the hybridization of different orbitals occurs. In this case, we need to know that sp 2 hybridization requires mixing of one s -orbital and two p -orbitals to produce three sp 2 orbitals. The following diagram shows the transition of s and p orbitals of the boron (B) in BF 3 to hybridized orbitals: In this case, we can draw out a Lewis diagram of BF 3 : As we can see, in BF 3 , boron (B) is the central atom, and it forms three sigma bonds with three fluorine (F) atoms. To accommodate these three sigma bonds, boron undergoes sp 2 hybridization, resulting in three sp 2 hybrid orbitals. Therefore, a molecule that has a central atom with sp 2 hybridization is BF 3 . Option A. CH 4 Incorrect. In CH 4 , carbon (C) is the central atom, and it forms four sigma bonds with four hydrogen (H) atoms. To accommodate these four sigma bonds, carbon undergoes sp 3 hybridization, resulting in four sp 3 hybrid orbitals: Option B. BF 3 Correct. In BF 3 , boron (B) is the central atom, and it forms three sigma bonds with three fluorine (F) atoms. To accommodate these three sigma bonds, boron undergoes sp 2 hybridization, resulting in three sp 2 hybrid orbitals. Therefore, a molecule that has a central atom with sp 2 hybridization is BF 3 : Option C. NH 3 Incorrect. In NH 3 , nitrogen (N) is the central atom, and it forms three sigma bonds with three hydrogen (H) atoms. To accommodate these three sigma bonds and a lone pair, nitrogen undergoes sp 3 hybridization, resulting in four sp 3 hybrid orbitals: Option D. H 2 O Incorrect. In H 2 O, oxygen (O) is the central atom, and it forms two sigma bonds with two hydrogen (H) atoms and forms an additional two lone pairs of electrons. To accommodate these two sigma bonds and two lone pairs, oxygen undergoes sp 3 hybridization, resulting in four sp 3 hybrid orbitals: Option E. CF 4 Incorrect. In CF 4 , carbon (C) is the central atom, and it forms four sigma bonds with four fluorine (F) atoms. To accommodate these four sigma bonds, carbon undergoes sp 3 hybridization, resulting in four sp 3 hybrid orbitals: Therefore, the answer is B .

question.text: Which of the following molecules has a carbon atom with sp 3 hybridization?

explanation.concept_text: To solve this problem involving hybridization , we need to know that how the hybridization of different orbitals occurs. We need to know that one s -orbital and three p -orbitals combine to form four sp 3 hybrid orbitals. The following diagram shows the transition of s and p orbitals of the carbon of C 2 H 5 OH to hybridized orbitals: In this case, we can draw out a Lewis diagram of C 2 H 5 OH: In the above diagram of C 2 H 5 OH, the central carbon atom forms four sigma bonds with two hydrogen atoms, one neighboring carbon atom, and an oxygen atom. To accommodate these four sigma bonds, the carbon atom undergoes sp ³ hybridization , adopting a tetrahedral geometry. Therefore, Option E is the correct answer. Option A. C 2 H 4 Incorrect. In C 2 H 4 , the central carbon forms three sigma bonds with one other carbon and two other hydrogens. In addition, it also forms a pi bond with the other carbon (which forms the double bond). To accommodate these three sigma bonds, the central carbon atom undergoes sp 2 hybridization, not sp 3 hybridization: Option B. CH 2 O Incorrect. In CH 2 O, the central carbon atom forms three sigma bonds: two with hydrogen atoms and one with the oxygen atom. Additionally, it forms a pi bond with the oxygen atom, creating a double bond. To accommodate these three sigma bonds and one pi bond, the carbon atom undergoes sp 2 hybridization, not sp 3 hybridization: Option C. C 2 H 2 Incorrect. In C 2 H 2 , each of the carbon atoms form two sigma bonds with the hydrogen atoms and one sigma bond with the adjacent carbon atom. The carbon atoms also have two pi bonds between them. To accommodate these three sigma bonds and two pi bonds, the carbon atoms in C 2 H 2 undergo sp hybridization, not sp 3 hybridization: Option D. C 2 H 3 Cl Incorrect. In C 2 H 3 Cl, one of two carbon atom forms three sigma bonds with one other carbon and two other hydrogen atoms. The other carbon atom forms three sigma bonds with one other carbon atom, one other hydrogen atom, and one chloride atom. The carbon atoms also have a double bond between them. To accommodate these three sigma bonds and one pi bond, the carbon atoms in C 2 H 3 Cl undergo sp 2 hybridization, not sp 3 hybridization: Option E. C 2 H 5 OH Correct. In C 2 H 5 OH, one of two carbon atoms forms sigma bonds with three hydrogen atoms and a sigma bond with the other carbon atom. The second carbon atom engages in sigma bonding with two hydrogen atoms, as well as sigma bonding with another carbon atom and an oxygen atom. To accommodate these four sigma bonds, both carbon atoms in C 2 H 5 OH undergoes sp 3 hybridization: Therefore, the answer is E .

question.text: Which of the following molecules has a central atom with sp hybridization?

explanation.concept_text: To solve this problem involving hybridization , we need to know that how the hybridization of different orbitals occurs. We need to know that one s -orbital and one p -orbitals combine to form two sp hybrid orbitals. The following diagram shows the transition of s and p orbitals of the carbon of CO 2 to hybridized orbitals: In this case, we can draw out a Lewis diagram of CO 2 : In CO 2 , the central carbon atom forms two sigma bonds with two oxygen atoms. In addition, the carbon atom also forms two pi bonds with the two oxygen atoms (which forms the double bonds). To accommodate these two sigma bonds, the central carbon atom undergoes sp hybridization, resulting in two sp hybrid orbitals. Therefore, a molecule that has a central atom with sp hybridization is CO 2 . Option A. CO 2 Correct. In CO 2 , the central carbon atom forms two sigma bonds with two oxygen atoms. In addition, the carbon atom also forms two pi bonds with the two oxygen atoms (which forms the double bonds). To accommodate these two sigma bonds, the central carbon atom undergoes sp hybridization, resulting in two sp hybrid orbitals: Option B. CH 4 Incorrect. In CH 4 , the central carbon atom forms four sigma bonds with four hydrogen atoms. To accommodate these four sigma bonds, the central carbon atom undergoes sp 3 hybridization, resulting in four sp 3 hybrid orbitals: Option C. C 2 H 4 Incorrect. In C 2 H 4 , the central carbon forms three sigma bonds with one other carbon and two other hydrogens. In addition, it also forms a pi bond with the other carbon (which forms the double bond). To accommodate these three sigma bonds, the central carbon atom undergoes sp 2 hybridization: Option D. BF 3 Incorrect. In BF 3 , the central boron atom forms three sigma bonds with three fluorine atoms. To accommodate these three sigma bonds, the central boron atom undergoes sp 2 hybridization, resulting in three sp 2 hybrid orbitals: Option E. SF 6 Incorrect. In SF 6 , the central sulfur atom forms six sigma bonds with six fluorine atoms. To accommodate these six sigma bonds, the central sulfur atom undergoes sp 3 d 2 hybridization, resulting in six sp 3 d 2 hybrid orbitals: Therefore, the answer is A .

question.text: Each of the following is an example of a molecule with sp 3 hybridization EXCEPT one. Which one is the EXCEPTION?

explanation.concept_text: To solve this problem involving hybridization , we need to know that how the hybridization of different orbitals occurs. In this case, we need to know that one s -orbital and one p -orbitals combine to form two sp hybrid orbitals. The following diagram shows how the electrons are distributed for the central carbon in CO 2 : In this case, we can draw out a Lewis diagram of CO 2 : In CO 2 , the central carbon atom forms two sigma bonds with two oxygen atoms. In addition, the carbon atom also forms two pi bonds with the two oxygen atoms (which forms the double bonds). To accommodate these two sigma bonds, the central carbon atom undergoes sp hybridization, resulting in two sp hybrid orbitals. Therefore, a molecule that has a central atom with sp hybridization is CO 2 . Therefore, the exception is CO 2 . Keep in mind that we need to find the molecule that does not have sp 3 hybridization. Option A. NH 3 Incorrect. NH 3 has a nitrogen (N) atom at its center, which forms three sigma bonds with three hydrogen (H) atoms. It also has a lone pair of electrons. To accommodate for three sigma bonds, NH 3 exhibits sp 3 hybridization: Option B. CH 4 Incorrect. In CH 4 , the central carbon atom forms four sigma bonds with four hydrogen atoms. To accommodate these four sigma bonds, the central carbon atom undergoes sp 3 hybridization, resulting in four sp 3 hybrid orbitals: Option C. H 2 O Incorrect. H 2 O has an oxygen (O) atom at its center, which forms two sigma bonds with two hydrogen (H) atoms and also has two lone pairs of electrons. To accommodate for the two lone pairs of electrons and two sigma bonds, oxygen in H 2 O exhibits sp 3 hybridization: Option D. CO 2 Correct. In CO 2 , the central carbon atom forms two sigma bonds with two oxygen atoms. In addition, the carbon atom also forms two pi bond with the two oxygen atoms (which forms the double bonds). To accommodate these two sigma bonds, the central carbon atom undergoes sp hybridization, resulting in two sp hybrid orbitals. Therefore, a molecule that has a central atom with sp hybridization is CO 2 . Therefore, the exception is CO 2 : Option E. PH 3 Incorrect. PH 3 has a phosphorus (P) atom at its center, which forms three sigma bonds with three hydrogen (H) atoms and has a lone pair of electrons. To accommodate for three sigma bonds and a lone pair of electrons, the phosphorus atom in PH 3 exhibits sp 3 hybridization: Therefore, the answer is D .

question.text: The bond angle of C 2 H 2 is 180 degrees. This phenomenon is best explained by C 2 H 2 ’s

explanation.concept_text: To solve this problem involving hybridization , we need to know that how the hybridization of different orbitals occurs. In this case, we can draw out a Lewis diagram of C 2 H 2 : We can see that in C 2 H 2 , each carbon (C) atom forms one sigma bond with one hydrogen atom and one sigma bond with an adjacent carbon atom. C 2 H 2 consists of a carbon-carbon triple bond. To accommodate for the sigma bond with the hydrogen atoms and the triple bond, each carbon atom undergoes sp hybridization. The following diagram shows how the electrons of carbon are distributed in C 2 H 2 : Therefore, the bond angle can be explained by sp hybrid orbitals . Therefore, the answer is A .

question.text: The hybridization in the NH 3 molecule is

explanation.concept_text: To solve this problem involving hybridization , we need to know that how the hybridization of different orbitals occurs. In this case, we can first draw out a Lewis diagram of NH 3 : As we can see in NH 3 molecules, the central nitrogen (N) atom undergoes sp 3 hybridization. These hybrid orbitals are used for bonding with three hydrogen (H) atoms, resulting in the formation of three sigma bonds. Additionally, one of the sp 3 hybrid orbitals contains a lone pair of electrons. To accommodate for the lone pair and three sigma bonds, the nitrogen must undergo sp 3 hybridization. Based on the Lewis diagram of NH 3 , the orbital diagram below shows how the electrons of nitrogen are distributed in NH 3 : Therefore, the answer is C.

question.text: Which of the following correctly labels the hybrid orbital formed in the given molecules?

explanation.concept_text: To solve this problem involving hybridization , we need to know that how the hybridization of different orbitals occurs. In this case, we can draw out a Lewis diagram of CO 2 : We will go over the hybridization of each element in CO 2 . The central carbon atom forms two sigma bonds with two oxygen atoms. In addition, the carbon atom also forms two pi bonds with the two oxygen atoms (which forms the double bonds). To accommodate these two sigma bonds, the central carbon atom undergoes sp hybridization. Each oxygen atom in CO 2 forms a sigma bond and a pi bond with the carbon atom and has two lone pairs of electrons. The oxygen atoms in CO 2 undergo sp 2 hybridization. Therefore, the option that has the correct label of the hybrid orbital formed in the given molecule is O in CO 2 ; sp 2 . Option A. C in CH 3 OH; sp 2 Incorrect. In CH 3 OH, carbon (C) is bonded to three hydrogen (H) atoms and one oxygen (O) atom. Carbon in this molecule undergoes sp 3 hybridization, not sp 2 , because it forms four sigma bonds: three with hydrogen atoms and one with oxygen: Option B. O in CH 3 OH; sp 2 Incorrect. In CH 3 OH, oxygen forms a sigma bond with carbon, a sigma bond with hydrogen, and also has two lone pairs of electrons. Therefore, the oxygen atom in CH 3 OH is sp 3 hybridized, not sp 2 : Option C. C in CH 4 ; sp Incorrect. In CH 4 , carbon forms four sigma bonds with four hydrogen (H) atoms. Therefore, the carbon atom in CH 4 is sp 3 hybridized, not sp : Option D. C in CO 2 ; sp 3 Incorrect. In CO 2 , carbon forms double bonds with two oxygen (O) atoms, which requires sp hybridization. The carbon atom in CO 2 is sp hybridized, not sp 3 : Option E. O in CO 2 ; sp 2 Correct. Each oxygen atom in CO 2 forms a sigma bond with the carbon atom and has two lone pairs of electrons. The oxygen atoms in CO 2 undergo sp 2 hybridization: Therefore, the answer is E .

question.text: Which of the following molecules has a central atom with sp 3 d hybridization?

explanation.concept_text: To solve this problem involving hybridization , we need to know that how the hybridization of different orbitals occurs. In this case, we can draw out a Lewis diagram of SF 4 : As we can see, in SF 4 , sulfur (S) is the central atom, and it forms four sigma bonds with four fluorine (F) atoms. It also has one lone pair of electrons. To accommodate the formation of four sigma bonds and one lone pair, sulfur undergoes sp 3 d hybridization. Therefore, the molecule that has a central atom with sp 3 d hybridization is SF 4 . Based on the Lewis diagram of SF 4 , the diagram below shows how the electrons of sulfur are distributed in SF 4 : Option A. SF 4 Correct . I n SF 4 , sulfur (S) is the central atom, and it forms four sigma bonds with four fluorine (F) atoms. It also has one lone pair of electrons. To accommodate the formation of four sigma bonds and one lone pair, sulfur undergoes sp 3 d hybridization: Option B. CH 3 OH Incorrect. In CH 3 OH, carbon (C) is the central atom, and it forms three sigma bonds with three hydrogen (H) atoms and one sigma bond with an oxygen (O) atom. It also has one lone pair of electrons. Therefore, carbon in CH 3 OH is sp 3 hybridized: Option C. H 2 O Incorrect. In H 2 O, oxygen (O) is the central atom, and it forms two sigma bonds with two hydrogen (H) atoms and two lone pairs of electrons. To accommodate these two sigma bonds and two lone pairs, oxygen undergoes sp 3 hybridization, resulting in four sp 3 hybrid orbitals: Option D. XeF 6 Incorrect. In XeF 6 , xenon (Xe) is the central atom, and it forms six sigma bonds with six fluorine (F) atoms. To accommodate these six sigma bonds, xenon in XeF 6 is sp 3 d 3 hybridized: Option E. NH 3 Incorrect. In NH 3 , nitrogen (N) is the central atom, and it forms three sigma bonds with three hydrogen (H) atoms, and has a lone pair. To accommodate these three sigma bonds and lone pair, nitrogen undergoes sp 3 hybridization, resulting in four sp 3 hybrid orbitals: Therefore, the answer is A .
